wikipedia_page.main:
Job Stewart (20 January 1934 – 23 October 1991) was a British stage and screen actor.
Born in Cape Town, South Africa, Stewart took to the stage in the 1950s, appearing in Shakespeare and in West End drama, then gained screen roles in film and on television.
Stewart was a close friend of Judi Dench and worked with her on Love in a Cold Climate (1980).His last screen work was in Hong Kong in the mid 1980s and he died there in 1991, aged 57.

response: The Duke is the central character in the historical novel, Shrewsbury (1897), by Stanley Weyman. As a minor but pivotal character, he was portrayed by Job Stewart in six episodes of the sprawling ensemble BBC serial The First Churchills (1969).Radio Times, Volume 185 (1969), p. 19
